content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="f of x, equals, 2 x plus, the tangent of, open parenthesis, x over 5, close parenthesis, minus 15" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The Intermediate Value Theorem applied to <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 10 comma 15, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> guarantees a solution in <math alttext="open bracket, 10 comma 15, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> to which of the following equations?

choices.label: <math alttext="f of x, equals negative 15" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></mrow></math>

topic.text: 1.16: Working with the Intermediate Value Theorem (IVT)

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
